results.title: Clay in a special way
results.creator_credit: Larry Schultz, Bill Snider and Oak Creek Films
results.brief_description: The film examines the positive, creative process of an art project with 4th, 5th and 6th grade students, handicapped and non-handicapped. An honest instructor expresses his initial doubts about teaching a “mainstreamed” class. Deaf and blind students participate with the aid of sign language interpreters and sighted students’ oral descriptions. Students are given information on the historical usage of clay through slides and a trip to a local museum. An artist, Maynard Fishler, visits the classroom to discuss his work. Throughout the project, a multi-sensory approach is used. The students decide to interpret transportation with clay, each student developing his own personal communication. The clay sculptures are the visual, concrete expression of a successful learning experience for all. Communication and creativity on may levels are results no less important.

results.title: Classic rock: the ultimate anthology
results.brief_description: This disc contains fourteen classic rock anthems from an array of British musicians, performed live. The tracks are: Wishbone Ash “Blowin’ free”; Argent “Hold your head up”; The Sensational Alex Harvey band “Delilah”; Uriah Heep “Return to fantasy”; Asia “Heat of the moment”; Focus “Sylvia”; Emerson, Lake & Palmer “The Barbarian”; Family “Strange band”; Curved air “Melinda more or less”; Slade “Get down and get with it”; Deep Purple “Child in time”; Free “I’ll be moving”; Thin Lizzy “The Sun goes down”; Barclay James Harvest “Mockingbird”.

results.title: City bound
results.creator_credit: Robin Carruthers, Ivan Scott, Denning Films and Spectator Productions
results.brief_description: A study of London’s transport system during World War II. Between 5.30am and 10.00am each morning London’s underground and above-ground transport fleet carried nearly five million workers to city offices, shops, factories, and dockyards; many of these people lived in the most distant residential outer suburbs of London, and were brought in to the city every day from distances of up to 30 miles or more away. “City bound” shows us the daily migration by train, tram, bus, and tube.

results.title: Cinema of vengeance
results.creator_credit: Robyn Russell, George Tan and Vengeance Productions
results.brief_description: A documentary on the history of Martial Arts in film, covering fifty years of Chinese action cinema from the late forties through to present day hi-tech action drama. “Cinema of Vengeance” features profiles of Jackie Chan, Jimmy Wang Yu, Bruce Li, Chow Yun-Fat, Gary Daniels, Samo Hung, Ti Lung, John Woo, Cynthia Rothrock, Don Wilson, Steve James, Mike Kelly and Joe Lewis. It also includes previously unseen footage and an exclusive interview with Bruce Lee.

results.title: Cinema
results.brief_description: Afghanistan, “Switzerland of Asia”, has about twelve million inhabitants and twelve cinemas. To one of these cinemas, the admission is one afghani. (Accorded the Award of Merit, Oberhausen).

results.title: Cinema
results.brief_description: Sebastian C. Schroeder’s sublime 1973 film ‘Cinema’, takes the physicality of film itself as a site of transformation, as celluloid itself metamorphoses into a magical realm for a group of Afghani children.
results.description: Sebastian C. Schroeder’s sublime 1973 film ‘Cinema’, takes the physicality of film itself as a site of transformation, as celluloid itself metamorphoses into a magical realm for a group of Afghani children.

results.title: Cicada
results.creator_credit: Division of Motion Pictures Extension Service
results.brief_description: The life cycle of the cicada, or, as it is commonly known, the seven-year locust. In spring, the pupa emerges. Time-lapse photography shows us the transition from pupa to winged insect, including the shedding of the pupal shell. The winged insect lays eggs, from which young insects hatch and drop to the ground to begin their underground larval stage of development. In the spring, they will emerge in the pupal stage, and the life cycle will commence again. Narration by J.A. Hyslop.
